thread.title: Here are the Atlanta Falcons’ top 10 cap hits for 2017
thread.title_full: Here are the Atlanta Falcons’ top 10 cap hits for 2017

title: Here are the Atlanta Falcons’ top 10 cap hits for 2017
text:
0 
January 30, 2017, Houston: Julio Jones is all smiles taking questions during Super Bowl Opening Night on Monday, Jan. 30, 2017, at Minute Maid Park in Houston. Curtis Compton/ccompton@ajc.com 
FLOWERY BRANCH – The Falcons stated that their No. 1 off season priority was to re-sign cornerback Desmond Trufant. 
While both side have worked on the deal, things are set to be finalize later in the offseason. 
As things stand, here are the Falcons’ top 10 salary cap hits heading into the 2017 season: 
QB Matt Ryan, $23.75 (14.14 percent of 2017 cap) 
WR Julio Jones, $13.9 million 
CB Robert Alford, $9.6 million 
C Alex Mack, $9.05 million 
CB Desmond Trufant, $8.026 million 
DT Dontari Poe, $8 million 
WR Mohamed Sanu, $7.4 million 
LG Andy Levitre, $6.625 million 
DE Adrian Clayborn, $5.4 million 
LT Jake Matthews, $5.2 million
